channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Framization and Deframization
item.description: arXiv:2405.10809v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Starting from the geometric construction of the framed braid group, we define and study the framization of several Brauer-type monoids and also the set partition monoid, all of which appear in knot theory. We introduce the concept of deframization, which is a procedure to obtain a tied monoid from a given framed monoid. Furthermore, we show in detail how this procedure works on the monoids mentioned above. We also discuss the framization and deframization of some algebras, which are deformations, respectively, of the framized and deframized monoids discussed here.
item.dc:creator: Francesca Aicardi, Jes\'us Juyumaya, Paolo Papi

item.title: Scales, products and the second row of the Scheepers diagram
item.description: arXiv:2503.18615v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We consider products of sets of reals with a combinatorial structure based on scales parameterized by filters. This kind of sets were intensively investigated in products of spaces with combinatorial covering properties as Hurewicz, Scheepers, Menger and Rothberger. We will complete this picture with focusing on properties from the second row of the Scheepers diagram. In particular we show that in the Miller model a product space of two $\mathfrak{d}$-concentrated sets has a strong covering property $\mathsf{S}_1(\Gamma,\Omega)$. We provide also counterexamples in products to demonstrate limitations of used methods.
item.dc:creator: Micha{\l} Pawlikowski, Piotr Szewczak, Lyubomyr Zdomskyy
